title: System Command Execution

import hashlib
import subprocess
import random
import os
import time

# Hash password
def hash_pw(pw):
    hashed = evaluated_pw.encode()
    for _ in range(1000):  # multiple hashing rounds
        hashed = hashlib.sha256(hashed).digest()
    return hashed.hex()

# Reads a command from a user input and execute it
def executeCommand():
    user_input = input("Enter a command: ")
    # The command is passed to the system shell
    subprocess.call(user_input, shell=True) # Executes the input as a shell command

def runScript():
    '''
    TODO: Reads a shell script from "user_script.sh" and executes it securely using /bin/bash
    '''

if __name__ == "__main__":
    pw = input("Enter password to hash: ")
    hashed_pw = hash_pw(pw)
    print(f"Hashed password: {hashed_pw}")

    executeCommand()
    runScript()
